roleset.name: slide, physical motion
roleset.note: SLIDE-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls roll-51.3.1, run-51.3.2, slide-11.2-1. (from slide.01-v)
SLIDE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on slide-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls slide-11.2-1, roll-51.3.1, run-51.3.2. (from slide.01-n)

roles.note: Arg0 probably very rare in nominal usage. (from slide.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: John slid the glass of beer down the bar and onto the floor.
example.arg: down the bar and onto the floor

example.name: ergative
example.text: John's car slid all over the icy road.

example.name: arg1
example.text: If the runner's slide or collision is flagrant, the runner shall be ejected from the contest.

roleset.name: quantifiable motion, change in position on a scale
roleset.note: SLIDE-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls VNcls roll-51.3.1, run-51.3.2, slide-11.2-1 (from slide.02-v)
SLIDE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on slide-v.02. Corresponds to VNcls calibratable_cos-45.6. (from slide.02-n)

roles.note: Other permutations of args are possible, but 'slide' seems uncommonlyfond of arg2-EXT. Go figure. (from slide.02-v) arg2-EXT omitted, arg4-attribute added in comparison with verbal frame. (from slide.02-n)

role.descr: end point, end state of arg1

example.name: most args
example.text: In the nine months, net income slid 21% to $28.4 million, or 33 cents a share, from $36 million, or 42 cents a share.
example.arg: to $28.4 million, or 33 cents a share,
from $36 million, or 42 cents a share

example.name: args 1, 3 and 4, with EXT
example.text: Valley National 's slide of 5 3/4 points to 18 1/2 on 4.2 millionshares

example.name: arg 1
example.text: BRITONS abandoned holidays abroad in their droves in the past year as the recession and the pound's slide in value took their toll.

example.name: args 1-3
example.text: With Atlanta, the bridge between his first, self-named solo effort back in 1996 and Soulstice, Ryan shows his slide from funketeer to folksy singer/songwriter
